message.content:
cs.CY, cs.CE, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.TR

Reasoning: 
- cs.CY (Computers and Society): The paper discusses the social and environmental impacts of autonomous and shared autonomous vehicles, and how congestion pricing can incentivize more socially and environmentally optimal travel choices. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper uses an agent-based simulation model (MATSim) to investigate the effects of different congestion pricing and tolling strategies on traffic conditions and traveler welfare. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper discusses the development of the mobility landscape of autonomous driving and how it affects the performance of different pricing strategies. 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks): The paper discusses the possibility of refunding users by reinvesting toll revenues as traveler budgets, which plays a salient role in the overall efficiency of each CP strategy as well as in the public acceptability. 
- cs.TR (Transportation): The paper focuses on the impact of autonomous and shared autonomous vehicles on travel destinations and distances, mode choice, and congestion, and how congestion pricing can moderate demand and incentivize more optimal travel choices.
